title: Château de Tigné 2014 Gerard Depardieu Pinot Noir (Vin de France)
description: With its attractive red-fruit flavors, this is a light, perfumed wine. It has spice, fine acidity and a smooth texture that is just lifted by tannins. Drink now.

title: Vite Colte 2013 La Casa in Collina  (Barbaresco)
description: Leafy underbrush, coconut, mature dark-skinned berry and subtle mint aromas open. The approachable, straightforward palate offers raspberry, sour cherry, grilled sage and a hint of star anise alongside rounded, rather fleeting tannins. Drink through 2018.

title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2014 Senses Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)
description: There is much of the perfumed character of Touriga Nacional in this wine that goes with the ripe, juicy black fruits and acidity. At this stage, there is a strong spice from the wood aging and this needs to soften before the wine will be ready to drink. Wait until 2018.

title: Aldo Clerico 2012  Barolo
description: This opens with aromas that recall weedy underbrush, sawdust, toast and oak. The firm palate offers star anise, cured meat and a hint of oregano but not much fruit richness. Astringent tannins give it a raspy finish.

title: Antonio Mas 2011 Roll Fermentor Malbec (Tupungato)
description: This Malbec is a collection of disparate parts that doesn't justify its price. Reduced plum and grapy berry aromas come with woodsy notes of menthol and cola. Highly herbal, saucy, savory flavors are more oaky than fruity, while this finishes with muscular tannins and savory, grapy notes.

title: Aveleda NV Casal Garcia Rosé Sparkling (Vinho Verde)
description: This is crisp and fresh medium-sweet wine. It is bright with red-currant acidity and ripe with a strawberry and cream flavor. The wine is clean, lively and, of course, ready to drink.

title: Battaglio 2013  Barbaresco
description: Cellar floor, eucalyptus, black spice and a note recalling grilled celery lead the nose. The ripe palate offers mature black cherry, star anise and a hint of orange zest while assertive, tightly knit tannins leave an astringent finish.

title: Bella Grace 2013 Estate Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This full-bodied wine is in the classic mode, offering very ripe and even overripe aromas. Voluptuous berry flavors verge on sweet, and the rich texture comes without a lot of drying tannin.

title: Bodega Calle 2014 Alberti 154 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Roasted, woodsy, rubbery aromas are gamy and staunch, with berry notes interspersed. Grabby, rubbery tannins make for a rugged palate, while roasted plum and gamy flavors are a touch salty. A tannic finish doesn't change much.

title: Borgogno F.lli Serio e Battista 2012  Barolo
description: Berry, menthol and a hint of espresso aromas lead the way while the straightforward palate shows mature black-skinned berry, coffee and a hint of licorice. It's already approachable. Drink through 2020.

title: Bret Brothers 2014 Climat La Colonge  (Pouilly-Loché)
description: This wine comes from less than an acre in Mâcon's smallest appellation. The result is a tight wine with a steely edge. Strong citrus and crisp apple flavors are lifted by the nervy acidity and finished with a shot of lemon juice. Let this wine calm down and drink from 2017.

title: Rui Reguinga 2013 Quinta de Vale Veados Touriga Nacional-Syrah Red (Tejo)
description: Ripe, fruity and with soft tannins, this is a ready-to-drink wine. It has bright-black currant acidity, immediately drinkable berry fruits and a fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
designation: Quinta de Vale Veados Touriga Nacional-Syrah

title: Rutini 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)
description: Snappy, citric aromas are modest in terms of fruit and depth. This SB feels dry and citrusy, while basic orange and lime flavors control the palate. A simple, slightly salty finish rushes by on an acidic base.

title: Nicolas Maillet 2013  Pouilly-Fuissé
description: This wine is honeyed and ready to drink. It has a round character, creamy with pineapple and apricot flavors. It is attractive, ripe and fruity.

title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2014 Les Cailles Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)
description: While this wine has a serious amount of wood aging, some fruit weight could allow it to develop. However, as the wine opens, the wood becomes stronger. Spice, toast and tannins show strongly at the end.

title: Rain Dance 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Tart and earthy, this hints at sour cherry fruit. But the acids bring a wash of lemon juice, along with tongue-scraping tannins. The finish carries a hint of green herbs. Best to give this a good decanting to help smooth it out.

title: Ribafreixo 2013 Barrancôa Red (Alentejano)
description: This is a soft, fruity wine that has black fruits and lively acidity. It is gently structured with enough tannins and is smooth enough to be immediately accessible. It's ready to drink now.

title: The Williamsburg Winery 2013 Trianon Cabernet Franc (Virginia)
description: Aromas of stewed red currants and blackberries mingle with sweet tobacco and vanilla on the nose. These notes carry to the medium-bodied palate that shows a mild concentration of flavors over a buttery lactic feel.

title: Salvano 2011 Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: This opens with aromas suggesting toasted hazelnut, coconut, stewed prune and a balsamic note. The firm palate shows sour cherry, raw cranberry, thyme and ground pepper alongside somewhat underripe, close-grained tannins that leave an astringent finish.

title: Santa Julia 2014 Magna Red (Mendoza)
description: Berry and plum aromas are lively but suggestive of wet animal fur. A pinched, tannic mouthfeel sets up jumpy, herbal wild berry and animal-like flavors. Salty, roasted, herbal and slightly stewy on the finish.

title: Louis Max 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: Ripe and fruity, this wine offers crisp apples and pear-juice flavors. It has a strongly tangy element that is refreshing and delicious now.

title: Lovingston 2014 Petit Manseng (Monticello)
description: Golden in color, this Petit Manseng (with 10% Seyval Blanc) underwent carbonic maceration, giving it punchy notes of lemon, grapefruit and pineapple rind on the nose and palate. Rich in feel, almost to the point of being flabby, there's just enough acid to maintain balance.

title: Punta del Cielo 2012 Chardonnay (Mendoza)
description: Tropical aromas of pineapple and sea water are good but briny. Ditto the palate, which is full, grabby and showing mature citrus flavors that are salty and pulling. An interesting wine given that it's from 2012. Drink now.

title: Quinta da Lapa 2013 Reserva Touriga Nacional (Tejo)
description: The wine is soft with black fruits and attractive acidity. With generous tannins and just a hint of the perfumed character of the grape, the wine is easy, ripe and ready to drink.

title: El Solar de Orfila 2013 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Saucy, stewy plum and licorice aromas lead to a wiry palate with grabby tannins. Lightly herbal berry flavors come with a shading of oak, while the finish is herbal and minty tasting, with a sense of raw freshness stemming from latent acidity.

title: Innocent Bystander 2014 Pinot Gris (Victoria)
description: The scents of toasted brioche and vanilla reflect the fact that half of the wine was barrel fermented. As a result, it's got some weight and texture to it, but the fruit, outside a dash of pineapple, is relatively muted.

title: Hawks View 2014 Hawks View Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Lightly earthy flavors of dried raspberries have a chunky, almost rustic character, with a bass note of wet cement. It's a serviceable wine, solid and short, with none of the elegance of the finer Pinots.

title: Golan Heights Winery 2010 Yarden Rosé Brut Sparkling (Galilee)
description: This sparkling blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Noir has the faintest touch of blush color. On the nose, it offers grapefruit and lemon. Bubbles are not very persistent, lasting just moments after the glass is poured. It has flavors of tart Granny Smith apple, brioche and lemon peel and a zippy finish.

title: Domaine Ferret 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé
description: This wine is crisp and fruity. It has attractive acidity, a nice touch of spice and a backbone of minerality. The juiciness leaves a bright, crisp aftertaste.

title: Leonard Kreusch 2015 Bernkasteler Kurfürstlay Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Pressed apple and dusty mineral notes scent the nose of this subdued slightly savory Riesling. Juicy tangerine and Meyer lemon flavors lend sweetness to the midpalate. The moderately long finish is accented by dustings of pollen and saffron.
